It's National School Breakfast Week!
To encourage more families to take advantage of the healthy choices available for school breakfast, Hartselle City Schools will celebrate National School Breakfast Week during March 2-6, 2020.
Busy weekday mornings make it a challenge for many families to find time for a healthy breakfast. However, the US Department of Agriculture data shows that more and more students are starting their day with a nutritious breakfast in their school cafeterias. The USDA School Breakfast Program currently serves 14 million students every day. Studies show that students who eat school breakfast are more likely to:
Reach higher levels of achievement in reading and math
Score higher on standardized tests
Have better concentration and memory
Be more alert
Maintain a healthy weight

During National School Breakfast Week, every elementary and intermediate student that eats breakfast in the cafeteria will receive a Tiger Breakfast Club wristband. All students that wear their wristband to lunch on Friday, March 6th, will receive a free ice cream at lunch that day!

post_text: Hartselle High School hosted the 2nd annual Career Fair on Friday, September 20. Hartselle Chamber of Commerce, Redstone Federal Credit Union, Sonoco, CerroWire, and Pepsi of Decatur sponsored the event. Students from Hartselle High School and Hartselle Junior High School enjoyed the time as they interacted with local businesses, industries, military, and career professionals. Students were provided information about future careers and opportunities that await them at graduation. Thank you to everyone who worked hard to make this day a success!

The HHS Speech and Debate Team competed at the first tournament of the season, Vestavia Novice, hosted by Vestavia Hills High School in Birmingham.
Competing in Lincoln-Douglas debate was Keegan Hembree. In public forum debate were two-person teams G.G. Stout with Izen Thornton and Walt Shelton with Olivia Patterson. Olivia also received 4th place in speaker points for PF debate.
Brinkley Cottingham and Maggie Lindsey competed in impromptu speaking. Jenni Cate Rhodes and Emilee Boster (along with Samantha Simmons, not pictured) competed in original oratory. Emilee Boster finished in 6th place.
Congratulations!
